page.title: 09 Cookhill Priory
page.content: In the 13th century Isabell,Countess of Warwick founded a Nunnery on the site of the present day Priory,which lies 3 miles to the east of Inkberrow on the Ridge Way.In 1542 it was granted to Nicholas and Catharine Fortescue and has been passed down the family ever since.Today it is owned by an elderly spinster called Miss Antrobus and it has been converted into a farm.The only original part is the chapel,made of timber and cased with grey brick,now derelict but it still contains many plaques commemorating the Fortescue family.Of this chapel the only original parts are the east and north walls.Miss Antrobus lives at the rear and Mr.Bevan occupies the front part.On the side is a wooden Tudor dwelling which originally housed the servants but is now occupied by a young couple.
